ext_descriptions.ext_description: The a3m_accuracy_type_name type is an extensible list of types of accuracy that is used by .
The a3m_detected_difference_type_name type is an extensible list of types of detected difference that is used by .
The a3m_element_type_name type is an extensible list of types of comparing or compared elements that is used by .
It provides a mechanism to refer to an instance of one of these data types that specifies equivalence assessment.
The a3m_measured_data_type_name type is an extensible list of types of measured data that is used by .
The accuracy_associated_target_select allows selection of the data type that shall be associated with .

The detailed_report_style_type is a type to allow selection of either inspected_element or defect_element. The former requires inspection report on all the inspected elements. The latter requires inspection report only on elements judged as having inequivalence defect.
This type is used in the definition of entity.
a detailed inspection report is required on all the inspected elements.
a detailed inspection report is required only on elements judged as having inequivalence defect.
The inspected_equivalence_element_select specifies an extensible select of the element type to be inspected that is clarified in each inspection requirement.

The preferred_report_ordering type allows selection of either in_notable_order or in_detected_order. The former requires inspection report in notable order starting from the most significant result. The latter requires inspection report in detected order. This type is used in the definition of entity.

ext_description.p: inspection report is required to be presented in notable order starting from the most significant result.
ext_description.note: Whether the largest value or the smallest value is the most notable data depends on the criterion.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: inspection report is required to be presented simply in detected order.
The representative_value_type is a type to allow selection of required type of representative inspected value. It has four enumerated values.
average representative value is required.
maximum representative value is required.
minimum representative value is required.
both minimum and maximum representative values are required.

The summary_report_style_type is a type to allow selection of required type of summarized inspection result report. It has three enumerated values. The selection of this type affects to .
This type is used in the definition of entity.
a conclusion showing whether or not a defect exists is required.
a report on the number of inequivalence defects is required.
a report on the number of inspected elements is required.

An A3m_equivalence_accuracy_association is a relationship between an
and an
for the inspection of the criterion.
the identifier for the A3m_equivalence_accuracy_association.
a human-interpretable name assigned to the A3m_equivalence_accuracy_association.
the text that provides further information about the A3m_equivalence_accuracy_association.

an
for use in the inspection.

an
to be associated.
An A3m_equivalence_assessment_by_logical_test is an entity that represents an assessment specification by a logical test.
An A3m_equivalence_assessment_by_numerical_test is an entity that represents an assessment specification by a numerical test.

an
to select either
or
for evaluating the measured value. If the measured value is within the specified range or limit, then the equivalence concern represented by the criterion is satisfied, namely, equivalence defect exists.

An A3m_equivalence_criteria_representation is a type of
that represents requirements on annotated 3d model equivalence for one pair of product data. It is a collection of one or more criteria on annotated 3d model equivalence represented by . An instance of this entity may be used independently to represent equivalence requirement before particular product data is converted, or may be used together with , that represents inspection results, to represent what requirement is satisfied or not to what degree by the particular pair of product data.

At least one instance of
referenced from an A3m_equivalence_criteria_representation shall be of type .

An A3m_equivalence_criterion is a type of
that represents a criterion that is an aspect of the requirements on annotated 3d model equivalence for a particular pair of product data together with an inspection requirement representing the necessary conditions for appropriate inspection(s) for the judgement of satisfaction or dissatisfaction of the criterion. It is a supertype of all the detailed criterion that are specified in companion standards, such as annotated_3d_model_equivalence_shape module, annotated_3d_model_equivalence_assembly module and annotated_3d_model_equivalence_PMI module.
selection of assessment type.

an
to identify one of the comparison target product data.

an
to identify the other comparison target product data.

an
to identify a type of inspected value.

to identify .

an
to identify types of accuracy.

An instance of this entity shall not be used as
of the .

An A3m_equivalence_criterion_with_specified_elements is a type of
that enables identification of comparison target elements.

an
to specify one of the comparison target product data element.

an
to specify the other comparison target product data element.

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_accuracy is a representation of the accuracy of the numerical calculation for use in the measurement. It is either the accuracy required for use in the measurement or the accuracy actually applied in the measurement. It may be specified either as a general accuracy effective for all the measurements or as a specific accuracy effective only for the identified measurement.
the text that provides further information about the A3m_equivalence_inspection_accuracy.

an
to select a range or a limit of a value for representing the accuracy.

An A3m_equivalence_inspection_requirement_with_values is a type of
having constraining information of inspection requirement such as maximum allowable tolerance for approximation and the tolerance for use in discretization.

a
to apply for representing constraining information.

An instance of this entity shall not be used as
of the .
An A3m_equivalence_lower_value_limit is a type of . This entity represents a lower limit of value used in assessment specification.

The
of the
shall be 'minimum'.
An A3m_equivalence_report_request is a specification of a report to be generated as a result of inspection for an .
the identifier for the A3m_equivalence_report_request.
a human-interpretable name assigned to the A3m_equivalence_report_request.
the text that provides further information about the A3m_equivalence_report_request.

concerned.
A A3m_equivalence_upper_value_limit is a type of . This entity represents a upper limit of value used in assessment specification.

The
of the
shall be 'maximum'.

An A3m_equivalence_value_limit is a type of
and a type of
that specifies a qualified numerical value representing either the lower limit or the upper limit of a particular quantifiable characteristic.

of the
shall be 'minimum' or 'maximum'.

An A3m_equivalence_value_range is a type of
that is a pair of numbers representing the range in which the value shall lie for use in specifying thresholds of criteria or accuracies for measurements.

a
which is the lower limit.

a
which is the upper limit.

A Detailed_equivalence_report_request is a type of
that requests detailed inspection report on the criterion concerned. In order to control the volume of the report and report sequence, two attributes are provided.
What entity instance caused inequivalence defect and what is the inspected value calculated will be a typical detailed report that may be used for improving the product model concerned.
an
defined in
shall be instantiated as the detailed report corresponding to the specification defined in this entity.

to select either
or .

or .

that controls maximum number of instances reported.
an INTEGER value to control maximum number of instances reported.
